episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of quirky and intriguing facts, including the escape abilities of eels, a Swedish politician's unusual phobia, the use of red wine as a radiation treatment post-Chernobyl, and the surprising origins of famous songs.

facts.fact: If an eel ends up in a predator's stomach, it can reverse out through its gills.
Sweden's Minister for Equality has a pathological fear of bananas.
After Chernobyl, nearby children were treated for potential radiation sickness with compulsory hourly drinks of red wine.
The song 'Take Me Home, Country Roads' was written by three people who had never been to West Virginia.
